title: Verify that Apply changes works when the Replay Ticket Exchange Version Settings panel is shown or hidden

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV with valid credentials
2. Navigate to Sysytem Setup > Application properties and set 'replay.2.0.enabled' as false
3. Navigate to System Setup > AFP , select agency
4. Click Apply Changes and verify that Apply changes works
5. Navigate to Sysytem Setup > Application properties and set replay.2.0.enabled' as true
6. Navigate to System Setup > AFP and set Replay Marketplace Version as 1.0
7. Click Apply Changes and verify that Apply changes works
8. Set Replay Marketplace Version as 2.0
9. Click Apply Changes and verify that Apply changes works
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Home page is displayed
2. replay.2.0.enabled' should be set as false
3. Agency should be selected
4. Apply Changes shouls save changes successfully
5. replay.2.0.enabled' should be set as true
6. Replay Marketplace Version should be set as 1.0
7. Apply Changes shouls save changes successfully
8. Replay Marketplace Version should be set as 1.0
9. Apply Changes shouls save changes successfully

title: Verify When using Patron Market Permissions Utility without specifying a Currency Code, values are updated in PV database, but are not visible in ProVenue UI.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV with valid credentials:
https://pvqaf1.provenueapp.com:18443/
apiuserj47 / Password47t
2. In Patron Management > Market Permissions, 
bring the resale agency into context to view 
the permissions that are set to inherit for an 
account
3. Navigate to Utilities > Patron Market 
Permissions and use the resale agency and 
event (or some other set of parameters to 
narrow down result set) then click find
4. Click the ?Report? button next to ?View Detailed 
Report? to confirm the accounts brought into 
context
5. Next, under the ?Agency Name? field, bring the 
desired agency to edit into context.  
In the Replay Ticket Exchange Version 
Settings, click ?Modify? next to ?Override Seller 
Charge?.
Enter in new values into the Seller Calculation 
Type and the Seller Charge (Percent or 
Amount)
Do not make a selection in the ?Currency 
Code? drop down
6. Click ?Apply Changes? at the bottom of the screen.  The utility screen displays the new ?Seller Calculation Type? in the 
Utility, but appears grayed out. The entered ?Seller Charge Percent? is not displayed.
7. Navigate to Patron Management > Market Permissions for one of the impacted accounts (based on report pulled in step 
3).  Look at the permissions for the agency used.  Note, that the updates are not visible in the UI.
8. Navigate to the database and view the values, comparing to the values visible to user in ProVenue UI.  They do not 
match
9. Note, if the ?Currency Code? is selected in the utility, the ?Seller Charge Calculation Type? and ?Seller Charge? (amount or 
percent) values are not grayed out after changes applied.  When 'Currency Code' is specified, the values are visible in 
the UI.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Application should be launched successfully
2. Event should be created
3. Configuration of SMCSM set as unavailable
4. Venue config V2 api ran successfully
5. Return the user defined BTQR error message 
defined within the buyer type whose rules 
were not met.
6. Changes applied successfully and utility screen displays the new ?Seller Calculation Type? in the Utility, but appears 
grayed out. The entered ?Seller Charge Percent? is not displayed.
7. 
8. Values should match with PV application values
9. It is expected that non-inherited values should be visible through ProVenue UI.  If it is determined that a ?Currency 
Code? should always be specified as an input parameter, an error message should be presented to the user stating that 
changes cannot be made until the ?Currency Code? is specified.

title: Verify whether Patron market permissions are reflecting correctly in DB when creating patron in PVO UI and market permission is  Percentage

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1)An agency and user should be available
2. Login into PV with valid credentials
3. create a new patron in PVO UI and note 
patron account ID
4. Run Query -PV database to confirm the 
patron market permissions -
                select patron_account_id, 
seller_calculation_type_code, 
currency_code, seller_markup_amount, 
seller_markup_percent from 
patron_market_permissions where 
patron_account_id in (#####);
5. 1)Add patron market permissions for patron 
-do inherit
2)Run Query -PV database to confirm the 
patron market permissions -
                select patron_account_id, 
seller_calculation_type_code, 
currency_code, seller_markup_amount, 
seller_markup_percent from 
patron_market_permissions where 
patron_account_id in (#####);
6. 1)Change from Inherit-Percentage and  provide 
Percentage values 
2)Run Query -PV database to confirm the patron 
market permissions -
                select patron_account_id, 
seller_calculation_type_code, currency_code, 
seller_markup_amount, seller_markup_percent 
from patron_market_permissions where 
patron_account_id in (#####);
7. 1)Reselect the  Inherit option
2)Run Query -PV database to confirm the 
patron market permissions -
                select patron_account_id, 
seller_calculation_type_code, 
currency_code, seller_markup_amount, 
seller_markup_percent from 
patron_market_permissions where 
patron_account_id in (#####);
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. 
3. 
4. Permission should not showsale
5. The calculation type and the fixed amount and 
currency should be null because its inherited
6. The currency, calculation type, and changed 
amount should be written
7. All fields should writen out with correct data

number.

title: Verify whether When a Replay 2.0 Market offer is being created with Split quantity, check whether sum of consecutive ticket seller price of split quantity tickets is more than seller charge amount.

5. Select the Event Created and Select an Financial patron.
6. Set the Inclusive Seller Charge and Seller Calculation Type as Fixed.
7. Verify whether When a Replay 2.0 Market offer is being created with Split quantity, check whether sum of consecutive 
ticket seller price of split quantity tickets is more than seller charge amount.
8. The seller ticket prices for example are: 
Ticket 1 - $30
Ticket 2 - $18
Ticket 3 - $25
Ticket 4 - $20
Ticket 5 - $35
Ticket 6 - $20
 
If the split quantity is 2, the inclusive seller charge amount cannot be less than $45 (sum of ticket prices of ticket 
3,4), if the seller calculation rule is Fixed.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be Logged in Successfully.
2. Event should be Created Successfully.
3. Market Offer with the Least Split Quantity should be created Successfully.
4. Ticket Sales Portal should be Displayed.
5. Event and Patron should be Selected.
6. Settings should be Saved Successfully.
7. The application should pick the appropriate tickets 
to calculate the sum of sale prices.
8. The application should not sum up ticket 2, ticket 3 as that leaves out a stranded seat ticket 1 and This Example may 
become complex for split quantity 3 considering leaving out singles.
